intro: Pherosphaera niphophila, commonly known as the snowflake plant, is a unique succulent native to the cold, arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its ability to thrive in harsh, snowy environments. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the snow has fully melted. Its leaves are fleshy and covered in a fine, white coating that helps reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. This species is well adapted to extreme cold and can survive temperatures as low as -40°C.
